title: Watch Shinzo Abe Totally Shut Down Trump as President Tries to End Presser Early | Mediaite

persons.name: shinzo abe totally shut down trump

organizations.name: mediaite watch shinzo abe totally shut down trump

text:
Watch Shinzo Abe Totally Shut Down Trump as President Tries to End Presser Early by Joe DePaolo | 1:56 pm, February 10th, 2017 
President Donald Trump tried to cut off his joint press conference on Friday with Shinzo Abe , Prime Minister of Japan after just three questions — two from American journalists (one from the New York Post , and one from Fox Business), and one from a Japan-based outlet. 
“I want to thank everybody in the room,” Trump said. “We’re gonna have a tremendous relationship, long-term relationship of mutual benefit with Japan. Thank you all very much.” 
But Abe was having none of it. He wanted more. 
“One more, one more.” He told the President. 
“Yes, sure.” Trump said, as Abe called on a second Japan-based journalist. 
After Trump addressed the reporter’s query, the President was less subtle in his desire to leave the stage. After all, a weekend at Mar-A-Lago awaits. 
“Mr. Prime Minister, what an honor,” Trump said. “What a great honor. And let’s go to Florida! 
Watch above, via CNN.
